snippet: CGI Federal took a lot of criticism for its development of HealthCare.gov, but the website’s new contractor is busy recruiting CGI employees and the Obama administration may extend the company’s role.
abstract: CGI Federal took criticism for its development of HealthCare.gov Web site, but new contractor Accenture is busy recruiting CGI employees to work under its supervision; Obama administration is negotiating to extend CGI's role, even after denigrating company's work and replacing it as largest contractor on project.

byline.original: By ROBERT PEAR and IAN AUSTEN
byline.contributor: Robert Pear reported from Washington and Ian Austen from Ottawa.

lead_paragraph: CGI Federal took a lot of criticism for its development of HealthCare.gov, but the website’s new contractor is busy recruiting CGI employees and the Obama administration may extend the company’s role.

headline.main: Creators Still in Demand on Health Care Website
headline.print_headline: Creators Still in Demand on Health Care Website

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
